com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk

Class AclipsaSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDK

  • public class AclipsaSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    The class used to access the Aclipsa servers

      • createVideo

        public java.lang.String createVideo(AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKVideoHandler clientHandler,
                           com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKVideo video,
                           java.lang.Object tag,
                           java.lang.Boolean bypass_encoding,
                           boolean deleteLocalAfterProcessing)
        Create a video by uploading it on the Aclipsa server

        This method always returns immediately with the video identifier which can be used for referencing the video

        Parameters:
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        video - An AclipsaSDKVideo video to be uploaded. Can not be nil
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        deleteLocalAfterProcessing - Boolean value to indicate if the video will be deleted by the SDK after uploading
        Returns:
        (String) video identifier

      • createVideo

        public java.lang.String createVideo(AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKVideoHandler clientHandler,
                           Uri selectedVideoUri,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.Object tag,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.util.AbstractMap.SimpleImmutableEntry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> attributes,
                           boolean bypass_encoding)
        Create a video by uploading it on the Aclipsa server

        This method always returns immediately with the video identifier which can be used for referencing the video

        Parameters:
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        selectedVideoUri - A Uri that points to the video to be uploaded. Can not be nil
        title - A title for the video
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        attributes - Key value pair of attributes describing the video
        bypass_encoding - Boolean value to indicate if encryption will be bypassed when processing the video
        Returns:
        (String) video identifier

                              AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKMessageHandler clientHandler,
                              java.lang.Object tag,

                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> recipientTsuis)
        Forward a message to recipients
        Parameters:
        context - The activity's context
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        optionalNewTitle - An optional title for the message, passing null will use the original title
        optionalNewCaption - An optional text message that can be included in the message, passing null will use the original caption
        message - The message object to be forwarded
        newMessageGuid - New message unique id
        recipientTsuis - An array of recipient user IDs. The array must contain at least one user ID.
        Returns:
        (String) thread id

      • getMessageThreadFromID

        public void getMessageThreadFromID(AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKMessageHandler clientHandler,
                          java.lang.Object tag,
                          java.lang.String threadID)
        Get a list of messages from server given a thread id
        Parameters:
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        threadID - Filter message using threadID 
        
        public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKMessageHandler{

            private ListView messageListView;

            @Override
            protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
                setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);

                //Acquired from getThreads
                String threadID = getIntent().getStringExtra("threadId");

                messageListView = (ListView) v.findViewById(R.id.conversationListView);

                AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).getMessageThreadFromID(this, “MY_THREAD_TAG”, threadID);
            }


            @Override
            public void apiCreateMessageSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode,
            String errorString, String guid) {
                //Called when message creation was a success

            }

            @Override
            public void apiMessageRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString, Object response) {
                //Used for querying message(s)
                if(tag != null){
                    if(tag.equals(“MY_THREAD_TAG”){
                        if(response != null){
                            ArrayList messages = (ArrayList)response;

                            //implement a custom adpater to handle AclipsaMessage object
                            MessageAdapter messageAdapter = new MessageAdapter(getActivity(), R.layout.thread_item, messages);

                            messageListView.setAdapter(threadAdapter);
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

            @Override
            public void apiMessageRequestResponseFailure(Object tag, int statusCode,
            String errorString) {
                //Handle failure
            }
        }

      • getMessageThreads

        public void getMessageThreads(AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKMessageHandler clientHandler,
                     java.lang.Object tag)
        Get a list of message threads from server

        Message thread is a collection of messages between n number of users

        Parameters:
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller 
        
        public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKMessageHandler{

            private ListView conversationListView;

            @Override
            protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
                setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);


                conversationListView = (ListView) v.findViewById(R.id.conversationListView);

                AclipsaSDK.getInstance(getActivity()).getMessageThreads(this, “MY_THREAD_TAG”);
            }


            @Override
            public void apiCreateMessageSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode,
            String errorString, String guid) {
                //Called when message creation was a success
            }

            @Override
            public void apiMessageRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString, Object response) {
                //Used for querying message(s)
                if(tag != null){
                    if(tag.equals(“MY_THREAD_TAG”){

                        if(response != null){
                            ArrayList threads = (ArrayList)response;

                            //implement a custom adpater to handle AclipsaThread object
                            ThreadAdapter  threadAdapter = new ThreadAdapter(getActivity(), R.layout.thread_item, threads);

                            conversationListView.setAdapter(threadAdapter);
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

      • loginUser

        public void loginUser(java.lang.String userIdentifier,
             AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKHandler clientHandler,
             java.lang.Object tag)
        Logs the user with userIdentifier in as the user for the session
        Parameters:
        userIdentifier - The id string for the user to be logged in
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose tag to identify the caller 
        
        public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKHandler{

            @Override
            protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
                setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);

                String CLIENT_KEY = "Your client key";
                String DEMO_PASSPHRASE = "your passphrase";

                //Same string implemented on manifest which is a requirement;
                String CONTENTPROVIDER_AUTHORITY = "com.mycontentProvider";

                String SAAS_URL = "saas.aclipsa.com";

                AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).register(CLIENT_KEY, deviceUuid, DEMO_PASSPHRASE, CONTENTPROVIDER_AUTHORITY,
                "https", SAAS_URL, this, "REGISTER");
            }

            @Override
            public void apiRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString) {
                if(tag != null){
                    if(tag.equals("REGISTER")){
                        AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).loginUser("user1",this, "LOGIN");
                    }
                    else if(tag.equals("LOGIN")){
                        //SDK Ready to use
                    }
                }
            }

            @Override
            public void apiRequestResponseFailure(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString) {
                if(tag != null){
                    if(tag.equals("REGISTER")){
                        //handle register error
                    }
                    else if(tag.equals("LOGIN")){
                        //handle login error
                    }
                }
            }
        }

      • playVideo

        public void playVideo(Context context,
             AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKHandler clientHandler,
             AclipsaVideo aVideo,
             com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKVideoView view,
             OnPreparedListener optionslPreparedListener,
             java.lang.Object tag)
               throws com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKException
        Play a video
        Parameters:
        context - The calling activity's context
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        video - AclipsaVideo object to be played
        view - VideoView container the video to be played
        optionslPreparedListener - set the OnPreparedListner object of the video view (Optional)
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        Throws:
        com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKException - 
        
       public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKHandler{

        @Override
        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
            super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
            setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);

            AclipsaVideoView videoView = findViewById(R.id.videoView);

            //passed to this activity
            AclipsaVideo mVideo = getIntent().getStringExtra(“myVideo”);


            try {
                AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).playVideo(this, this, mVideo, videoView, onPreparedListener, null);
            } catch (AclipsaSDKException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        }

        @Override
        public void apiRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode,
        String errorString) { }

        @Override
        public void apiRequestResponseFailure(Object tag, int statusCode,
        String errorString) { }
        }

      • playVideoFromMessage

        public void playVideoFromMessage(Context context,
                        AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKHandler clientHandler,
                        AclipsaMessage message,
                        com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKVideoView view,
                        OnPreparedListener optionslPreparedListener,
                        OnCompletionListener onCompletionListener,
                        java.lang.Object tag)
                          throws com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKException
        Play a video embedded in a message
        Parameters:
        context - The calling activity's context
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        message - AclipsaMessage with video to be played
        view - VideoView container the video to be played
        optionslPreparedListener - set the OnPreparedListner object of the video view (Optional)
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        Throws:
        com.aclipsa.aclipsasdk.AclipsaSDKException - 
        
        public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKHandler{
            @Override
            protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
                setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);

                AclipsaVideoView videoView = findViewById(R.id.videoView);

                //passed to this activity
                AclipsaMessage message = getIntent().getStringExtra(“myMessage”);


                try {
                    AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).playVideo(this, this, message, videoView, onPreparedListener, null);
                } catch (AclipsaSDKException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            }

            @Override
            public void apiRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode,
            String errorString) { }

            @Override
            public void apiRequestResponseFailure(Object tag, int statusCode,
            String errorString) { }
        }

      • register

        public void register(java.lang.String apiKey,
            java.lang.String deviceUuid,
            java.lang.String passPhrase,
            java.lang.String authority,
            java.lang.String scheme,
            java.lang.String base_url,
            AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKHandler clientHandler,
            java.lang.Object tag)
        Register an instance of the client
        Parameters:
        apiKey - API Key
        deviceUuid - Device Unique ID
        passPhrase -
        authority - Content provider authority
        scheme - Url scheme of the server. "http" or "https"
        base_url - Url of the Aclipsa SAAS server
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller 
        
    public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKHandler{

        @Override
        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
            super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
            setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);

            String CLIENT_KEY = "Your client key";
            String DEMO_PASSPHRASE = "your passphrase";

            //Same string implemented on manifest which is a requirement;
            String CONTENTPROVIDER_AUTHORITY = "com.mycontentProvider";

            String SAAS_URL = "saas.aclipsa.com";

            AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).register(CLIENT_KEY, deviceUuid, DEMO_PASSPHRASE, CONTENTPROVIDER_AUTHORITY,
            "https", SAAS_URL, this, "REGISTER");
        }

        @Override
        public void apiRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString) {
            if(tag != null){
                if(tag.equals("REGISTER")){
                    AclipsaSDK.getInstance(this).loginUser("user1",this, "LOGIN");
                }
                else if(tag.equals("LOGIN")){
                    //SDK Ready to use
                }
            }
        }

        @Override
        public void apiRequestResponseFailure(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString) {
            if(tag != null){
                if(tag.equals("REGISTER")){
                    //handle register error
                }
                else if(tag.equals("LOGIN")){
                    //handle login error
                }
            }
        }
    }

      • sendMessage

        public java.lang.String sendMessage(Context context,
                           AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKMessageHandler clientHandler,
                           java.lang.Object tag,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String msgText,
                           Uri selectedVideoUri,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> recipientTsuis,
                           boolean bypass_encoding,
                           java.lang.String msgGuid,
                           java.lang.String orientation,
                           boolean deleteVideoAfterward)
        Sends a message to recipients
        Parameters:
        context - The activity's context
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        title - An optional title for the message
        msgText - An optional text message that can be included in the message
        selectedVideoUri - An optional Uri that points to the video to be uploaded
        recipientTsuis - An array of recipient user IDs. The array must contain at least one user ID.
        msgGuid - (Optional) ID for this message
        orientation - (Optional) Indicate orientation of video (landscape or portrait)
        deleteVideoAfterward - Delete the video locally after its done uploading
        Returns:
        (String) message identifier 
        
        public class MyActivity extends Activity implements AclipsaSDKMessageHandler{

            @Override
            protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
                setContentView(R.layout.myactivity_activity);

                ArrayList recipients = new ArrayList();
                recipients.add(“recipient_1);
                recipients.add(“recipient_2”);

                String id = AclipsaSDK.getInstance(getActivity()).sendMessage(this, this,
                “MY_TAG”, “Title - Hey”,
                “How’s everything going?”, null, recipients, false,
                “MESSAGE_ID_12345”, "portrait", false);
            }

            @Override
            public void apiCreateMessageSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString, String guid) {
                //Called when message creation was a success

                if(tag.equals(“MY_TAG”){
                    //Message creation was a success
                }
            }

            @Override
            public void apiMessageRequestResponseSuccess(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString, Object response) {
                //Used for querying message(s)
            }

            @Override
            public void apiMessageRequestResponseFailure(Object tag, int statusCode, String errorString) {
                //Handle failure
            }
        }

      • sendMessageForThread

        public java.lang.String sendMessageForThread(Context context,
                                    AclipsaSDK.AclipsaSDKMessageHandler clientHandler,
                                    java.lang.Object tag,
                                    java.lang.String title,
                                    java.lang.String msgText,
                                    Uri selectedVideoUri,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> recipientTsuis,
                                    boolean bypass_encoding,
                                    java.lang.String msgGuid,
                                    java.lang.String orientation,
                                    boolean deleteVideoAfterward)
        Sends a message to recipients
        Parameters:
        context - The activity's context
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        title - An optional title for the message
        msgText - An optional text message that can be included in the message
        selectedVideoUri - An optional Uri that points to the video to be uploaded
        recipientTsuis - An array of recipient user IDs. The array must contain at least one user ID.
        bypass_encoding - Tell the server not to encrypt the video
        msgGuid - (Optional) ID for this message
        orientation - (Optional) Indicate orientation of video (landscape or portrait)
        deleteVideoAfterward - Delete the video locally after its done uploading
        Returns:
        (String) thread id

      • unyankMessage

                 java.lang.Object tag,
                 AclipsaMessage msg)

        Allows the message to be seen by the recipients again

        Parameters:
        clientHandler - Callback (interface) for SDK responses
        tag - General purpose object to identify the caller
        msg - AclipsaSDKMessage object to delete

               java.lang.Object tag,
